definition[0]: to provide something such as food, entertainment, or transport for a group of people
example[0]: They laid on a buffet for his farewell party.
example[1]: A bus has been laid on to take you home.
definition[1]: to ask someone to do something, especially something that is difficult or something they will not want to do
example[2]: Sorry to lay this on you, but we need someone to give a talk at the conference next week.
definition[2]: to praise someone or something too much, especially in order to get what you want
definition[3]: to talk about something in a way that makes it seem more important, serious etc than it really is
